ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An in-depth look at the theoretics and politics of performance, both historically and currently. Professor Roach is one of the pioneers in this subject and inspiring to learn from. Definitely not a class to be missed!
Take this course if you have any interest in the subject! You won't be disappointed.

Performance Studies was--unexpected. A fantastic deconstruction of the everyday, every day. A class of discovery and introspection--of placing myriad lenses on the world around us, so that everything exploded in kaleidoscope colors. A story-telling class, where the events of our lives could be held up to academic analysis and intellectual critique. It was truly beautiful. It was a unique class, that called for unique thought-- take this class. Take it not for the reading, perhaps, or the theory--but simply the pleasure of taking apart the everyday with the direction of one of the best professors Yale has to offer. A man who sees the beauty in everything. There's meaning--and gravitas--and delight--in the slightest sliver of an idea, the most mundane morsel of thought. A professor who cares for you, the student, and whatever you may have to offer, be it the guilty pleasure of a sneeze or the rite of passage of a Mory's cup.
A brilliant class for any and all students. Take this class!!!!

Performance Studies is great. I took this class to build a foundation and vocabulary about studying performance, and it was supremely useful, fascinating, and enthusiastic. It's an incredible field, and class discussions were great. I particularly appreciated the opportunity to express myself and apply what we learned to life experiences in the class's 3 short papers.
